originalTitle: Pilot praised after crash-landing faulty Somali passenger plane on seashore
title: A Super Pilot Saves the Day in Somalia!
content:
Hello from Africa!

Hello everyone, it's your friendly news reporter for Africa! I have a very exciting and happy story to share with you today. It's about a big airplane and a very brave pilot right here in our amazing continent of Africa. This story happened in a country called Somalia. Somalia is a beautiful country in East Africa, right next to the big blue ocean.

A Big Plane Ride

Imagine you are sitting in a big airplane. It's a plane that carries many people, called a passenger plane. On this plane, there were 55 people! That's like many, many classrooms full of friends, all flying together! They were all flying high in the sky, maybe looking down at the clouds or the land below. Everything was going well.

A Small Problem in the Air

As the plane got closer to the ground, it was time to land. Airplanes usually land on a very long, flat road made just for them. This special road is called a runway. But on this day, something was not quite right with the plane. The plane found it hard to land on the runway in the usual way. Uh oh! This could have been a big problem. Did you know? Airplanes are checked very carefully by clever mechanics before every flight to make sure they are safe. But sometimes, even big machines can have tiny problems.

Our Brave Pilot's Amazing Idea!

This is where our hero comes in! The pilot of the plane was very, very clever and brave. Pilots go to special schools and train for many years to learn how to fly planes and how to think fast if something unexpected happens. Our pilot remembered all his training. He looked out of the window and saw something important: a big, sandy beach! Did you know? Somalia has a very long coastline, which means lots of beaches where the land meets the sea. This pilot was lucky to have such a soft place nearby!

Landing on the Seashore!

Instead of trying to land on the runway that day, the pilot made a super-smart decision. He decided to land the plane on the seashore! Yes, right on the sand next to the water. It was a big surprise for everyone on board, but it was also a very clever idea. The plane touched down softly on the sand. Imagine a big bird landing gently on the beach! That's kind of what it was like.

Everyone is Safe!

And guess what? Because of the pilot's amazing skills and quick thinking, every single one of the 55 people on the plane was safe! No one got hurt at all. They all walked off the plane, happy and thankful. It was a very good ending to what could have been a scary day. Did you know? When pilots do something amazing like this, they are often "praised." This means people say very good things about them and thank them for their bravery.

Why Pilots Are So Important

This story teaches us how important pilots are. They are not just drivers of the plane; they are super problem-solvers! They learn to stay calm even when things are difficult. They use their smart brains to keep everyone safe. Did you know? Pilots train in special machines called simulators. These machines feel just like flying a real plane, but they stay on the ground. This helps pilots practice for all kinds of situations.

What Happens Next?

Now, the plane will be checked very carefully by engineers. They will look at why it couldn't land on the runway properly. This helps make sure all planes stay very safe for future flights. Our brave pilot will get lots of thanks and praise for his amazing work. He truly saved the day!

A Happy Ending for Everyone

This wonderful story from Somalia reminds us that even when big challenges happen, with brave hearts and clever minds, we can find a safe way through. We are so happy that all the passengers and the brave pilot are safe and sound. What a fantastic example of bravery from our home in Africa!
summary: A super brave pilot landed a plane safely on a sandy beach in Somalia, saving all 55 people after the plane had trouble landing on the regular runway.
whyMatters: This story shows how smart and brave pilots are, how important it is for everyone to stay calm in tricky situations, and proves that even big problems can have very happy endings.

originalTitle: Son of Zambia's ex-President Lungu ordered to surrender 79 cars, petrol station and 'luxury' flats
title: Son of Zambia's ex-President Lungu ordered to surrender 79 cars, petrol station and 'luxury' flats
content: The High Court judgement says Dalitso Lungu, 39, failed to show they were acquired lawfully.

originalTitle: Kenya to confront Russia over 'unacceptable' use of its nationals in combat
title: Kenya Says 'No!' to Trouble Far Away!
content:
Hello, Little News Explorers!

Hello, hello, my wonderful friends! It's your friendly news reporter, here to tell you something very important that is happening right here in our amazing Africa. Today, we are going to talk about something special from our neighbour, Kenya. Have you ever heard of Kenya? It’s a beautiful country, just like ours, full of lovely people, amazing animals like giraffes and elephants, and vast, sunny plains! Today's news is about how Kenya is working hard to keep its people safe, even when they are far, far away from home. It's like when your mom or dad makes sure you are safe when you go to school or play outside. Kenya is doing something similar for its grown-up children.

Kenya's Big News!

So, what's the big news from Kenya? Well, Kenya is standing up and saying, "This is not okay!" They are talking to a very big country called Russia. Russia is very, very far away from Africa. It's on the other side of the world! Kenya is talking to Russia because some people from Kenya have been found in a place where there is fighting. **Did you know?** Kenya is known for its beautiful safaris where you can see lions, zebras, and many other amazing wild animals! It's a land of incredible natural beauty.

What is "Combat"?

You might be wondering, "What is fighting?" or "What is 'combat'?" When we say "combat," we mean a big fight, like a war, where soldiers are involved. It's a very serious and dangerous thing. It's not like playing tag or having a small disagreement with your friend. It's real fighting, where people can get hurt. Kenya does not want its people to be in places where there is combat, especially if they didn't know what they were getting into, or if they were tricked. That's why Kenya is speaking up. They want to make sure their people are safe and sound, not in harm's way.

Kenya Wants Its People Safe

Imagine your friend went to play in a park, but someone tricked them into going somewhere dangerous without telling them. You would want to help your friend, wouldn't you? That’s exactly what Kenya is doing. They want to make sure their citizens, which means people from Kenya, are safe. No parent wants their child to be in danger, and no country wants its people to be in danger either. The government of Kenya, which is like the big grown-ups who look after the whole country, is very worried about this. They think it's "unacceptable." Unacceptable means "not okay at all," something you should not do. It’s like when your teacher says running in the corridor is unacceptable because it's not safe. **Did you know?** The capital city of Kenya is called Nairobi! It's a very busy and exciting city.

Who Are These "Recruiters"?

Now, let's talk about some people called "recruiters." In this story, these are not good recruiters. They are "illegal recruiters." Think of "illegal" as "not allowed by the rules" or "against the law." These bad recruiters were tricking people from Kenya. They were telling them stories or promising them things to make them go to Russia. But they didn't tell them the whole truth, especially about the fighting. It's like someone promising you a lot of sweets if you go to a scary, dark place, without telling you it's scary and dark. These recruiters were trying to get people to join in the combat, even if they didn't want to or didn't know what it meant. That's very sneaky and not fair!

Stopping the Bad Guys!

Kenya’s government has been very busy! They have done something great. They have "shut down" these illegal recruiters. Shutting down means they stopped them completely. It’s like turning off a noisy machine that was bothering everyone. So, these bad recruiters cannot trick any more people from Kenya. Hooray for Kenya! This is a very important step. It helps to stop more people from getting into danger. The government is working hard to protect its citizens and make sure no one is tricked into going to fight in faraway lands. They are doing a good job keeping an eye out for their people. **Did you know?** The Great Migration, where millions of wildebeest and zebras travel across the plains, happens partly in Kenya. It’s one of the biggest animal spectacles on Earth!

Talking to Russia

Next, Kenya is going to "confront" Russia. This doesn't mean they are going to have a shouting match! When countries "confront" each other, it means they will talk about a serious problem face-to-face. They will "urge Moscow" to do something. Moscow is the capital city of Russia, so "urge Moscow" means asking the Russian government very strongly. Kenya wants to talk to Russia about the Kenyans who are there and make sure they are safe. They also want to make sure that no more Kenyans are involved in any fighting. It's like when you tell your friend, "Please don't do that again, it's not safe." Kenya is talking to a big, powerful country to protect its own people.

Making a Promise

What does Kenya want Russia to do? Kenya wants Russia to "sign a deal." A deal is like a big promise, written down on paper, that both sides agree to. This deal would be about "banning conscription." Banning means stopping something completely. "Conscription" here means not forcing or tricking people from Kenya to join the army or fight. So, Kenya wants Russia to promise that they will not let anyone trick or force Kenyans to fight in their wars. This deal would be a special agreement that says, "Kenyans are not for fighting in wars in Russia." It's a way to make sure everyone understands the rules and keeps Kenyans safe from harm. It's a very clever way to protect people. **Did you know?** There are many different languages spoken in Kenya, but the official languages are Swahili and English. "Jambo!" means "Hello!" in Swahili!

Why This is Important for Kenya

This whole situation is very important for Kenya. It shows that Kenya cares deeply about its people, no matter where they are in the world. It shows that Kenya is a strong country that will stand up for what is right. When a country protects its citizens like this, it makes everyone feel safer and prouder to be from Kenya. It's about human dignity and making sure people are treated fairly. No one should be tricked or forced into danger. Kenya is setting an example, showing that all people deserve to be safe and free to choose their own path, especially when it comes to something as serious as fighting.

Keeping Everyone Safe

So, remember, my little news adventurers! Kenya is doing a wonderful job looking after its people. They are stopping bad recruiters and talking to another big country, Russia, to make sure Kenyans are safe and not forced into fighting. It's all about making the world a safer place, one step at a time. We can all learn from Kenya's actions. It reminds us that it's important to be kind, to speak up when something is not right, and to always protect those who might be in danger. Keep exploring, keep learning, and keep being safe!
summary: Kenya is working hard to protect its people by stopping bad recruiters and asking Russia to promise not to involve Kenyans in any fighting far away from home.
whyMatters: This is important because Kenya wants to keep its citizens safe from danger and ensure no one is tricked into fighting in faraway places where they could get hurt.

originalTitle: EU votes to allow deportation of migrants to ‘safe’ third countries
title: EU votes to allow deportation of migrants to ‘safe’ third countries
content: New rule could be used to send asylum seekers to countries they have no ties to if they're 'deemed' safe.

originalTitle: Paramount expands offer for Warner Bros amid hostile takeover bid
title: Big Movie & Show Makers Want to Join!
content:
Hello, Super Story Lovers!

Hello, my super friends, from your favourite kid reporter here in Africa! Guess what exciting news we have today? It's about two really big companies that make all the amazing movies, cartoons, and TV shows we love to watch. Imagine two giant toy factories, full of fun and magic! These companies are called Paramount and Warner Bros. Maybe you've seen their names at the start of your favourite cartoon or superhero movie!

Who Are These Big Friends?

First, let's talk about Paramount. They are a super old and super big company from far away, in a country called America. They make many, many movies and TV shows. Think about all the adventures you've seen on screen – Paramount probably helped make some of them! They have been bringing us joy for a very long time. Did you know? Paramount has made movies for over 100 years! That's even older than your great-grandparents! Then there's Warner Bros. They are another giant company that brings us so much fun! They are famous for lots of incredible cartoons like Bugs Bunny, Tom and Jerry, and wonderful superhero movies with characters like Superman and Batman. They also make many other exciting shows and movies that kids all over the world, including us here in Africa, love to watch. Did you know? Warner Bros helped create some of the most famous cartoon characters in the world! They bring laughter to millions of children every day.

Paramount Wants a Big Hug with Warner Bros!

Now, here's the big news! Paramount has a super big idea. They want to join up with Warner Bros. It's like if your best friend wants to combine all their building blocks with all your building blocks to make one super-duper giant castle! When big companies join, they hope to make even more amazing things together, and share all their cool ideas and stories.

But Wait, There's a Little Puzzle!

Sometimes, when big companies want to join, it's not always super easy. It's like when you want to share your toys with a friend, but your friend isn't quite ready to put all their toys with yours. Paramount wants to buy Warner Bros, but Warner Bros might not be ready to say 'yes' just yet. They are still thinking about it and talking. This is what grown-ups call a 'takeover bid' – one company wants to 'take over' another. Did you know? Big companies joining can sometimes mean more variety and more shows for us to watch! It's like having a bigger menu at your favourite restaurant.

Paramount's Special New Offer!

Because Warner Bros is still thinking, Paramount came up with a very special new idea to show how much they really want to join. Paramount said, 'Okay, Warner Bros, we really, really want to be friends and join families! If it takes a little longer for you to decide and the deal doesn't close quickly, we will give you a special 'waiting bonus' every single month until you finally make up your mind!' This 'waiting bonus' is what grown-ups call a 'ticking fee'. It's like if your parents tell you, 'If you wait patiently for your birthday present, we'll give you an extra treat every week until then!' It's a way to say, 'We are serious, and we appreciate you taking your time to think.' This money is an extra gift just for waiting and talking. Did you know? Grown-ups often use special words for business, like 'ticking fee', but it just means a little extra something for waiting patiently!

Why is This Waiting Bonus Important?

This special 'waiting bonus' from Paramount shows that they are very, very keen to join with Warner Bros. They are saying, 'We are willing to give you extra reasons to come together, even if it takes a bit more time.' It's a way for Paramount to say, 'Please, let's make this happen!' It helps to make the other company feel good about taking their time to think carefully.

What Happens Next?

Right now, Paramount and Warner Bros are still talking. They are like two good friends trying to decide what game to play together. They are discussing all the details and making sure everyone is happy. Maybe soon, they will shake hands and become one big, happy family of storytellers! Did you know? When companies join, they can share their ideas and talented people to make even better stories and shows for everyone!

Why Does This Matter to Kids in Africa?

Now, you might be thinking, 'Why is this important to me, here in Africa?' Well, these big companies make the cartoons, movies, and shows that we love to watch on our TVs and tablets! If Paramount and Warner Bros join, it could mean even more amazing stories, new characters, and fantastic adventures for us to enjoy! Imagine if they combined all their best ideas – we could get even more exciting superheroes, funny cartoons, and heartwarming stories! It's like getting a bigger, better library full of all your favourite books, plus some new ones! We love to laugh and learn from these stories, and big news like this can mean more fun for everyone. Here in Africa, we connect with stories from all over the world, and these companies help bring them to us. When they grow bigger, they might have even more power to create and share wonderful content with children like you. It's all about bringing more smiles and magic to our screens!

A Brighter Future for Fun!

So, my friends, the story of Paramount and Warner Bros is still unfolding. It's like watching an exciting episode of your favourite show – you can't wait to see what happens next! We hope that whatever they decide, it means even more incredible stories and laughter for all of us here in Africa and around the world. Stay tuned for more fun news!
summary: Paramount, a big movie company, wants to join with another big company called Warner Bros, and they've offered an extra monthly 'waiting bonus' to help make the deal happen, promising more fun shows for kids.
whyMatters: This is important because these companies make many of the cartoons and movies we love. If they join, it could mean even more amazing shows and stories for kids in Africa to enjoy on TV and tablets.

originalTitle: Mateta knee injury 'not as bad as feared'
title: Mateta knee injury 'not as bad as feared'
content: The knee injury which scuppered Jean-Philippe Mateta's move to AC Milan last month is "not as bad as feared" and he will not need surgery, says Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner.
